intro: Onoctonia crassipes, commonly known as the broad-leaved nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its broad, waxy leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom at night. Its fruit is a fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Due to its toxic properties, it is not suitable for consumption by humans or livestock.
